item.title: 台湾称40%芯片产能转移至美国"不可能"
item.description: 台湾首席关税谈判代表表示，将台湾40%的半导体产能转移至美国"不可能实现"，此言是对近期美国官员呼吁大规模转移生产所作回应。【原文：It would be "impossible" to move 40% of Taiwan's semiconductor capacity to the U.S., the island's top tariff negotiator said, pushing back against recent comments by American officials who called for a major production shift.】

item.title: 澳大利亚人工智能基础设施开发商Firmus从黑石集团和Coatue获得100亿美元债务融资方案
item.description: 澳大利亚人工智能公司Firmus周一宣布，已完成由全球私募股权公司黑石集团和纽约科技投资机构Coatue Management牵头的100亿美元债务融资方案。【原文：Australian artificial intelligence company Firmus said on Monday it had finalised a $10 billion debt funding package led by global private equity firm Blackstone and Coatue Management, a New York-based technology investor.】

item.title: 据Semafor报道，Live Nation高管正与美国司法部进行谈判以避免诉讼。
item.description: 据Semafor周日报道，Live Nation公司高管及游说人士正与美国司法部高级官员进行磋商，试图避免因涉嫌非法垄断经营而面临法庭审判。【原文：Live Nation executives and lobbyists are in talks with senior officials at the U.S. Department of Justice in a bid to avoid a trial over allegations that the company operates an illegal monopoly, news outlet Semafor reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 全球最大内存互连芯片供应商蒙特奇即将登陆香港市场
item.description: 中国蒙太奇科技公司股票将于周一在香港首次公开发行，开盘价预计将上涨57.2%。这家全球最大的内存互连芯片供应商通过此次股票发行筹集了70.4亿港元（约合9亿美元）。【原文：Shares of China's Montage Technology are set to open 57.2% higher on its Hong Kong trading debut on Monday, after the world's biggest memory interconnect chip supplier raised HK$7.04 billion ($900 million) in a share sale.】

item.title: 亚洲股市反弹，日本股价飙升至历史新高
item.description: 亚洲股市周一大幅跳涨，日本首相高市早苗的压倒性胜利激发了市场对更多再通胀政策的期待，而华尔街在最后关头实现反弹也令投资者普遍松了一口气。【原文：Asian markets leapt higher on Monday as a resounding win for Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi whetted appetites for more reflationary policies, while there was widespread investor relief at Wall Street's last gasp rebound.】

item.title: 日元贬值加剧，高市早苗胜选为日本刺激政策铺路
item.description: 周一亚洲早盘交易时段，日元延续近期跌势。此前日本首相高市早苗在周日选举中轻松获胜，为进一步实施财政刺激措施扫清了障碍。【原文：The yen extended a string of recent losses in early Asian trading on Monday after Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi swept to victory in Sunday's election, easing the path to further fiscal stimulus.】

item.title: 日本市场为首相高市早苗的历史性选举胜利做好准备
item.description: 日本首相高市早苗领导的执政联盟于周日赢得历史性选举胜利，这为她兑现减税承诺、通过财政支出刺激经济提供了政治授权。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's coalition swept to a historic election win on Sunday, handing her a mandate to follow through on a pledge to cut taxes and reflate the economy through spending.】

item.title: 马斯克称SpaceX将优先在月球建造自生长城市
item.description: 埃隆·马斯克周日表示，SpaceX公司已将重心转向在月球上建造一座"自我增长的城市"，他称该目标可在十年内实现。【原文：Elon Musk said on Sunday that SpaceX has shifted its focus to building a "self‑growing city" on the moon, which he said could be achieved in less than 10 years.】

item.title: 油价下跌逾1%，因对美伊可能爆发冲突的担忧缓解
item.description: 周一开盘时，油价下跌逾1%，因美国与伊朗上周五完成一轮会谈后，市场对两国在中东可能爆发冲突的担忧有所缓解。【原文：Oil prices dropped more than 1% at Monday's open as concerns about a possible conflict in the Middle East between the U.S. and Iran eased after both countries finished a round of talks on Friday.】

item.title: 新加坡星展银行第四季度净利润下滑10%，低于预期
item.description: 新加坡最大银行星展集团周一公布的第四季度净利润同比下降10%，主要原因是净息差收窄。【原文：DBS Group , Singapore's biggest bank, posted fourth-quarter net profit on Monday that was down 10% over the same period a year earlier, mainly due to lower net interest margin.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，克罗格公司计划任命前沃尔玛高管格雷格·福兰为下一任首席执行官。
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周日援引知情人士报道，食品杂货巨头克罗格计划聘请前沃尔玛高管格雷格·福兰担任其下一任首席执行官。【原文：Grocery giant Kroger plans to hire Greg Foran, a former Walmart executive, as its next chief executive officer, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 独家：安哥拉寻求收购戴比尔斯20%-30%股权，高级官员透露
item.description: 安哥拉矿业部一名高级官员周日向路透社透露，该国正寻求收购英美资源集团旗下钻石业务戴比尔斯20%-30%的股权，目前正与其他非洲钻石生产国就此提案进行磋商。【原文：Angola is pursuing a 20%-30% stake in Anglo American's diamond unit De Beers, a proposal being discussed with other diamond-producing African nations, a senior official from Angola's mining ministry told Reuters on Sunday.】

item.title: 南非监管机构称埃斯孔公司可提高电费，涨幅超此前批准额度
item.description: 南非能源监管机构周日表示，在承认先前计算存在错误后，已批准国有电力公司埃斯孔在未来两个财年实施比原定幅度更大的电价上调。【原文：South Africa's energy regulator said on Sunday that it granted state utility Eskom larger electricity rate increases for its next two financial years than originally set after admitting errors in its earlier calculations.】

item.title: 美国财政部官员贝森特表示，美联储将对资产负债表调整采取稳妥推进的策略
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特·贝森特周日表示，即使美联储主席提名人凯文·沃什上任后，他也不认为美联储会迅速缩减资产负债表。此前沃什曾批评美国央行的债券购买计划。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Sunday he would not expect the Federal Reserve to move quickly to shrink its balance sheet, even under Fed chief nominee Kevin Warsh, who has criticized the U.S. central bank's bond purchases.】

item.title: 以色列反垄断机构将对埃尔阿尔航空处以3900万美元罚款，因其在战争期间哄抬票价
item.description: 以色列竞争管理局周日宣布，计划对国家航空公司以色列航空处以1.21亿谢克尔（约合3900万美元）罚款，因其在以色列对加沙战争期间设定过高且不公平的机票价格。【原文：Israel's Competition Authority said on Sunday it planned to levy a fine of 121 million shekels ($39 million) on flag carrier El Al Israel Airlines for setting excessive and unfair airfares during Israel's Gaza war.】

item.title: 日本财务大臣称，日本必须采取"专业"方式动用外汇储备
item.description: 日本财务大臣片山萨季周日表示，日本必须以"专业"方式动用其庞大的外汇储备来为支出和减税提供资金，因为这样做并不容易。【原文：Japan must take a "professional" approach in tapping its huge foreign reserves to fund spending and tax cuts as doing so would not be easy, Finance Minister Satsuki Katayama said on Sunday.】

item.title: 日本市场在选举压倒性胜利后，将迎来新一轮"高市商战"
item.description: 日本动荡的金融市场如今必须面对高市早苗首相牢牢掌控局势的局面——她在上周日的选举中取得压倒性胜利，这为她重振经济提供了明确的政治授权。【原文：Japan's volatile financial markets must now contend with Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi firmly in the driver's seat after her decisive victory on Sunday, which hands her an electoral mandate to reflate the economy.】

item.title: 纳米比亚能源部严厉批评道达尔能源和巴西国家石油公司未遵循程序
item.description: 纳米比亚周日发表声明称，该国对道达尔能源公司和巴西国家石油公司未向能源部通报或获得必要批准便在吕德里茨盆地获得新的近海区块表示关切。【原文：Namibia is concerned that TotalEnergies and Petrobras had acquired new offshore positions in the Luderitz Basin without informing the energy ministry or getting the necessary approval, it said in a statement on Sunday.】

item.title: 捷克总理支持禁止15岁以下青少年使用社交媒体
item.description: 捷克总理安德烈·巴比什周日表示，他支持禁止15岁以下儿童使用社交媒体，随着越来越多的欧洲国家考虑实施类似限制。【原文：Czech Prime Minister Andrej Babis said on Sunday he was in favour of banning the use of social media by children under 15, as a growing number of European countries consider similar restrictions.】

item.title: 投资者追逐更便宜、规模更小的公司，因避险情绪冲击科技板块
item.description: 投资者正转向成本更低、规模较小的公司，同时重新评估自己愿意承担多少风险来持有波动性资产——此前市场剧烈震荡重创了某些行业和资产。【原文：Investors are turning to cheaper, smaller companies while reassessing how much risk they are willing to take owning volatile assets after market whipsaws pounded some sectors and assets.】

item.title: 瑞银集团首席执行官呼吁建立瑞士违规银行家公共登记册以维护声誉
item.description: 瑞士应建立银行从业人员违反职业义务的公共登记册，以在瑞信集团倒闭后持续重建其声誉。总部位于苏黎世的私人银行宝盛集团董事在接受采访时如是表示。【原文：Switzerland should maintain a public register of bankers who have violated their professional duties, as it continues to rebuild its reputation following the Credit Suisse collapse, the director of Zurich‑based private bank Julius Baer said in an interview.】

item.title: 印度炼油商为推动美印贸易协议而回避俄罗斯石油
item.description: 炼油和贸易消息人士称，印度炼油商正避免采购4月份交货的俄罗斯原油，预计这种避购态势将持续更长时间。此举可能有助于新德里与华盛顿敲定贸易协议。【原文：Indian refiners are avoiding Russian oil purchases for delivery in April and are expected to stay away from such trades for longer, refining and trade sources said, a move that could help New Delhi seal a trade pact with Washington.】

item.title: 《华盛顿邮报》出版人威尔·刘易斯宣布离职，此前该公司进行了大规模裁员
item.description: 《华盛顿邮报》周六宣布，在经历本周大规模裁员后，其出版人兼首席执行官威尔·刘易斯将离职。【原文：Washington Post publisher and CEO Will Lewis is leaving the newspaper, it announced on Saturday after carrying out widespread layoffs this week.】

item.title: 彭博社报道，道尔西旗下Block公司将裁员多达10%
item.description: 据彭博新闻周六援引知情人士报道，杰克·多尔西旗下的金融科技公司Block正考虑在年度绩效考核期间裁减多达10%的员工。【原文：Jack Dorsey's fintech Block is considering cutting up to 10% of its workforce during annual performance reviews, Bloomberg News reported on Saturday citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国航空首席执行官同意就飞行员关切问题与飞行员工会会面
item.description: 美国航空公司首席执行官罗伯特·艾索姆周六表示，他将尽快与该航空公司的飞行员工会会面，因为飞行员们对该公司处理近期风暴事件及公司财务状况的方式日益担忧。【原文：American Airlines CEO Robert Isom said on Saturday he would meet with the carrier's pilots union as soon as possible, as concerns by aviators grow over its handling of a recent storm and company financials.】

item.title: Hims公司宣布停止提供GLP-1口服药，此前美国食品药品监督管理局警告将严厉打击
item.description: 此前美国食品药品监督管理局表示，将对这家远程医疗服务商采取行动，因其销售售价49美元的减肥药。【原文：This comes after the FDA said it would take action against the telehealth provider for its $49 weight-loss pill.】

item.title: 特朗普支持Nexstar与Tegna合并
item.description: 特朗普写道："我们需要更多力量对抗敌人——那些散布假新闻的国家电视台。""把这笔交易搞定！"【原文："We need more competition against THE ENEMY, the Fake News National TV Networks," Trump wrote. "GET THAT DEAL DONE!"】

item.title: 印美贸易协定为哈雷摩托车提供零关税准入，特斯拉未获豁免
item.description: 印度官员表示，根据一项临时贸易协定，印度将把美国高端汽车的关税从高达110%削减至30%，并取消哈雷戴维森摩托车的关税。但印度不会对电动汽车作出让步，这一举措明确将特斯拉排除在外。【原文：India will slash tariffs on high-end American cars to 30% from as high as 110% and eliminate duties on Harley-Davidson bikes under an interim trade pact, an official said, but will not make concessions for electric vehicles, a move that pointedly leaves Tesla out.】

item.title: 匈牙利反对党蒂萨党在选举纲领中承诺开征财富税并推行欧元化
item.description: 匈牙利反对党蒂萨党周六公布的240页选举纲领显示，该党计划对富人征收财富税，采用欧元货币，并将匈牙利牢牢锚定在欧盟和北约之中。【原文：Hungary's opposition Tisza party plans to introduce a wealth tax for the rich, adopt the euro currency and firmly anchor Hungary in the European Union and NATO, its 240-page election programme published on Saturday said.】

item.title: 土耳其副总统表示将维持紧缩的货币政策和财政纪律
item.description: 土耳其副总统切夫德特·伊尔马兹周六表示，土耳其将维持紧缩的货币政策并保持财政纪律，以进一步降低通胀率。【原文：Turkey will maintain its tight monetary policy and keep fiscal discipline in order to further lower inflation, Vice President Cevdet Yilmaz said on Saturday.】
